intro: Streptanthus gracilis, commonly known as the slender stalked crucifer, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, upright stems and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often with a slight pubescence. Streptanthus gracilis typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
